meanings.definition: A pair of lenses set in a frame and worn with one handle over each ear, used especially to correct vision.
meanings.sent1: She wore handglasses to help her see better.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist recommended handglasses for clearer vision.
meanings.sent3: When the dog tried on handglasses, it started chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: His world became clearer as if he had put on magical handglasses.
meanings.sent5: The handglasses transformed the fuzzy letters into sharp focus.

meanings.definition: A device consisting of a frame with a handle at each end, used for holding lenses before the eyes to assist in viewing distant objects.
meanings.sent1: The explorer used handglasses to spot faraway lands.
meanings.sent2: She peered through the handglasses to see the tiny details.
meanings.sent3: The detective pretended the handglasses were binoculars and started 'spying'.
meanings.sent4: With the handglasses, he could see beyond what others could perceive.
meanings.sent5: The handglasses revealed hidden beauty in the distance.
